intro: Knautia numidica, commonly known as the Numidian knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and somewhat woody. Knautia numidica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
